mdRecord.dcterms:title: Fresco Room, detail view
Room 205
Salle Lafayette
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas (American statesman, architect, and draftsman, 1743-1826) [architect]
La Montagne Saint-Hubert, Jean Robert (French painter and fresco painter, 1887-1950) [artist]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Fresco portrait of donor Ormond G. Smith, upper half, behind east door of north wall

Originally second-floor parlor, professor’s living quarters. Frescoed decoration installed 1929, a gift of Ormond G. Smith, as a tribute to the friendship between the United States and France. Flooring installed 1928. Frescoes executed by Robert and Marthe La Montaigne St. Hubert. Installation involved closing the fireplace and removal of the mantel and heating system. Room dedicated November 20, 1929; intended for use exclusively for oral doctoral examinations. — Mesick Cohen Waite, Pavilion VI: Historic Structure Report, 1991 [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: James Murray Howard University of Virginia Historic Buildings and Grounds Collection
